item.title: "The policies ‚Äî from allowing inmates to decide for...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The policies ‚Äî from allowing inmates to decide for themselves whether they want to wear masks, or just not providing them at all ‚Äî are at odds with guidance from both the Centers for Disease Control and the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment. It is also at odds with Gov. Jared Polis‚Äôs statewide mask mandate.

‚ÄúAll correctional facilities should provide masks to inmates at no additional cost and assure they are worn to protect the health of everyone within these facilities,‚Äù said a spokeswoman at the Colorado State Joint Information Center. ‚ÄúAll correctional facilities should be following Colorado‚Äôs indoor mask order.‚Äù

CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.

cpr.org

As Pandemic Worsens, Mask Rules In Jails Vary From County To County

CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "As many as 551 inmates have active cases at Arkansas...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"As many as 551 inmates have active cases at Arkansas Valley Correctional Facility, accounting for well over half of the 993 inmates housed at the prison, agency spokeswoman Annie Skinner said. Forty-five other inmates have since recovered. The outbreak was first detected Oct. 29, according to the state health department.

The outbreak is one of eight in state correctional facilities to infect more than 100 prisoners. The two largest outbreaks at the Sterling Correctional Fac...ility in northern Colorado and Fremont Correctional Facility near Ca√±on City have infected more than 700 prisoners living in each prison. The virus has spread fast in the facilities where inmates live in close quarters and social distancing is hard.

Seven prisoners have died from the virus thus far, including four prisoners from Sterling Correctional Facility and three from Fremont Correctional Facility. Eleven inmates from across the state Department of Corrections system are hospitalized, Skinner said."

See MoreA men's prison in Crowley County east of Pueblo is battling the largest active COVID-19 outbreak among state correctional facilities.

gazette.com

More than half of the inmates infected in COVID-19 outbreak at Colorado prison

A men's prison in Crowley County east of Pueblo is battling the largest active COVID-19 outbreak among state correctional facilities.A men's prison in Crowley County east of Pueblo is battling the largest active COVID-19 outbreak among state correctional facilities.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "The North Carolina Department of Public Safety has...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The North Carolina Department of Public Safety has suspended operations and moved prisoners away from the Randolph Correctional Center in Asheboro, the Southern Correctional Institution‚Äôs minimum custody facility in Montgomery County and the Piedmont Correctional Institution‚Äôs minimum custody facility in Rowan County.

North Carolina maxed out hospital bed capacity for its inmates, according to The Charlotte Observer, citing a briefing state prison leaders sent to staff."

Major prison outbreaks are ongoing in the U.S.

forbes.com

3 North Carolina Prisons Close After State Reportedly Maxes Out Hospital Space For Inmates

Major prison outbreaks are ongoing in the U.S.Major prison outbreaks are ongoing in the U.S.

item.title: To the people debating the Colorado Proud Boys on Saturday:...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

To the people debating the Colorado Proud Boys on Saturday:

There's no "talking it out" with a neo-fascist gang who brings armed neo-Nazis to family drag shows.

Fascism is not a valid philosophy and hate is not up for debate.

...

You can't debate revisionism, conspiracy theories, misogyny, xenophobia, anti Semitism, anti blackness, Islamophobia or transphobia.

These Proud Boys are enemies of the working class and they are committed to misunderstanding and hate.

The only way to talk to Nazis is with your fist.

Promotion of yt supremacy is not a valid contribution to the public conscience and we should reject anyone who says it is. We must reject the emboldenment of yt supremacy now or we are doomed to fight it in the future. Hate speech is inseparable from action and organization. People who defend the "free speech" of fascists are defending the claim that the community response to yt supremacy is equivalent to state repression. It is not.

Every Proud Boy rally presents an opportunity for fascists to network and collaborate. We know from history what happens time and time again when fascists achieve such coordination.The Proud Boys have violent goals and Colorado Proud Boys have been violent in Denver, Fort Collins and the Springs over and over and over again.

See More

item.title: "Tell him about what kind of hell you've been catching...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Tell him about what kind of hell you've been catching and tell him to clean his house up. And if he's not ready to clean his house up, he shouldn't have a house. It should catch on fire and burn down." Malcom X, 1962

Left Voice

After back-to-back hurricanes and years of cuts to social programs that have left thousands facing hunger and homelessness, the Congress of Guatemala has passed... yet another austerity budget that takes from the most vulnerable to line the pockets of the rich.

Now the people are taking to the streets to protest a government that does not represent them. Over 10,000 people gathered in the capital's central square.

In the first video, protestors can be seen setting the Congress on fire.
#guatemala #protests

item.title: On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist police killings, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order which would open an independent investigation into Elijah McClain‚Äôs death, led by state Attorney General Phil Weiser. This was after Aurora District Attorney Dave Young declined to file any charges against the killers, then the city of Aurora opened a sham investigation led by a former cop which was terminated because it was plainly not ‚Äúindependent‚Äù.... Now it is up to Phil Weiser to decide whether the cops and paramedics responsible for Elijah‚Äôs death will face any criminal charges.

But just this week, Governor Polis quietly loosened the scope of the investigation, allowing Weiser to investigate for ‚Äúoffenses‚Äù, not just ‚Äúcriminal activity‚Äù related to Elijah‚Äôs death, opening up the possibility for him to come back with watered down charges against the killers, like we saw in Breonna Taylor‚Äôs case. Polis also took out the words that suggest someone caused the death of Elijah McClain.

Polis must think that the movement isn‚Äôt paying attention, that we‚Äôve been subdued by the repressive arrests of movement leaders, and now he can reel back his investigation without opposition in the streets. He is wrong.

Join us for an emergency action to make it clear that we are still here and we are not going anywhere until we get justice for Elijah McClain!

MASKS REQUIRED (OVER YOUR NOSE & MOUTH!) & PLEASE KEEP DISTANCE BETWEEN YOURSELF AND OTHERS.

See More

SAT, NOV 21

EMERGENCY ACTION: Eyes on Weiser! Justice for Elijah McClain!

Colorado State Capitol

item.title: This is a blatant display of the hyper-exploitation of immigrant...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This is a blatant display of the hyper-exploitation of immigrant workers. A recent lawsuit alleges that managers at Tyson placed bets on how many workers would contract COVID-19 while working and ordered workers to continue working-- even while symptomatic.

A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.
